Name: 3D Modeling Ontology
Short description: A comprehensive 3D ontology with X3D 3.3 and X3DOM alignment.

Name: Additive Manufacturing and Maintenance Operations Ontology
Short description: Ontology in support of additive manufacturing for maintenance operations developed as part of the America Makes Additive With Knowledge project.

Name: Additive Manufacturing Ontology
Short description: Information systems architecture, including metrics, information models and validation methods to shorten the design-to-product cycle time in additive manufacturing (AM).
Authors/creators: Paul Witherell,Yan Lu,Jason Fox,Robert R. Lipman

Name: Additive Manufacturing and Maintenance Operations Ontology
Short description: Ontology in support of additive manufacturing for maintenance operations developed as part of the America Makes Additive With Knowledge project.

Name: AURORAL Adapters Ontology
Short description: This ontology aims at modelling the adapters for the AURORAL project.
Authors/creators: Ahlem Rhayem,Andrea Cimmino,Juan Cano de Benito,Maria Poveda Villalon,Raúl García Castro

Name: AURORAL Cell-Tower Ontology
Short description: This ontology aims at modelling the cell-tower information for the AURORAL project.
Authors/creators: Ahlem Rhayem,Andrea Cimmino,Juan Cano Benito,María Poveda Villalón,Raúl García Castro

Name: AURORAL Energy Ontology
Short description: This ontology aims at modeling the building energy consumption for the AURORAL project.
Authors/creators: Ahlem Rhayem,Andrea Cimmino,Juan Cano,María Poveda Villalón,Raúl García Castro

Name: AURORAL Logistic Ontology
Short description: This ontology aims at modelling the logistic domain for the AURORAL project.
Authors/creators: Ahlem Rhayem,Andrea Cimmino,Juan Cano,María Poveda Villalón,Raúl García Castro

Name: AURORAL Vehicle Charger Ontology
Short description: This ontology aims to model the electrical vehicle charger domain for the AURORAL project.
Authors/creators: Ahlem Rhayem,Andrea Cimmino,Juan Cano,Maria Poveda Villalon,Raul Garcia Castro

Name: Automotive Industry Ontology
Short description: The Auto Ontology combines information from more related ontologies in order to create a common language to be used within the AUTO Industry.

Name: Battery Interface Ontology
Short description: Ontology providing terms and relations needed to describe things, processes and data in the battery domain.
Authors/creators: Casper Welzel Andersen,Eibar Flores,Francesca Lønstad Bleken,Jesper Friis,Simon Clark

Name: Bicycle Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to represent the product type Bicycle in the context of the OPDM project.

Name: Brick
Short description: Brick is an open-source, BSD-licensed development effort to create a uniform schema for representing metadata in buildings.

Name: Building Automation and Control Network Ontology
Short description: BACnet is an ASHRAE sponsored protocol for building automation and control networks (IoT).

Name: Building Circularity Assessment Ontology
Short description: Building Circularity Assessment Ontology (BCAO) is proposed to structure the scattered heterogenous manufacturer product data needed for the assessment.

Name: Building Element Ontology
Short description: The Building Element Ontology provides an ontology based on the IfcBuildingElement subtree in the IFC specification, containing a taxonomy of classes that allow to define common building elements.

Name: Building Ontology
Short description: The Building ontology has been developed to perform as the core module of the BIMERR project, containing information related to buidling topology, components, materials and geometry. The geometry information is managed as information objects whitout entering in the details of the BIM model.

Name: Building Product Ontology
Short description: The Building Product Ontology defines concepts to describe (building) products in a schematic way.
Authors/creators: Anna Wagner,Christian Eller,Christian Leifgen,Laura Kristina Moeller

Name: Building Topology Ontology
Short description: The Building Topology Ontology (BOT) is a minimal ontology for describing the core topological concepts of a building.
Authors/creators: Mads Holten Rasmussen,Pieter Pauwels,Maxime Lefrançois,Georg Ferdinand Schneider

Name: Capability and Skills Ontology based on Industry Standards
Short description: A domain ontology to describe capabilities and skills. This ontology extends the concepts defined in the CSS ontology (https://github.com/hsu-aut/css-ontology) by using ontology design patterns for different standards.

Name: Capability and Skills Ontology based on Manufacturing
Short description: A domain ontology to model capabilities and skills in manufacturing. It extends CaSk by standards such as DIN 8580 (manufacturing operations),VDI 2860 (handling operations) as well as WADL and OPC UA to model skills with interfaces based on web services as well as OPC UA.

Name: Car HiFi Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe car hifis.

Name: Car Options Ontology
Short description: The COO provides a vocabulary for exposing available configuration options for car models. It allows indicating choices that can be made as well as compatibility, dependency and inclusion information.

Name: Chair Vocabulary
Short description: Web vocabulary to represent the product type Chair in the context of the OPDM project.

Name: Classification of Business Functions
Short description: The Classification of Business Functions (CBF 1.0) is intended for use in the production of business statistics, building on experiences from several recent surveys in Europe, Canada, the United States, and India. The primary use of business function statistics is to examine the details of international sourcing. However, it could also be applied to domestic sourcing..

Name: Clothing Product Information Ontology
Short description: The Clothing Product Information (CPI) vocabulary is a garment ontology for modeling product-specific and clothing-related information.

Name: Coffee Machine Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe coffee machines.

Name: Collaborative Manufacturing Service Ontology
Short description: Collaborative Manufacturing Services Ontology aims to describe both manufacturing domain and collaboration scemes between business entities especially for waste management and software solutions domains. NOTE: ontology files need to be extracted from ZIP archive before use.

Name: Components for ExtruOnt
Short description: An RDF/OWL schema for representing the components of an extruder.
Authors/creators: BDI – Interoperable Databases Group University of the Basque Country UPV/EHU

Name: Computer Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe personal computers, laptops and netbooks.

Name: Context Aware System Observation Ontology
Short description: Context Aware System Observation is an ontology for context aware system and observation services and was developed with the goal to describe all the processing of the context.

Name: Cooker and Oven Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe cookers and ovens.

Name: core
Short description: Core ontology for Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) RDL.

Name: Core Ontology for Robotics and Automation
Short description: It was developed within the IEEE 1872-2015 Standard Ontologies for Robotics and Automation. Specifies core conceptions of Robotics domain.

Name: Core Ontology for Robotics and Automation (Bare)
Short description: A standalone taxonomy of the concepts and properties in CORA, without links to SUMO or CORAX.

Name: CORAX
Short description: It was developed to provide concepts which were to general for CORA ontology, but did not exist in SUMO ontology, such as design, interaction and artifical system.

Name: Crystallography Domain Ontology
Short description: A crystallography domain ontology based on EMMO and the CIF core dictionary.
Authors/creators: Jesper Friis,Francesca Lønstad Bleken,Casper Welzel Andersen

Name: CSS Ontology
Short description: An ontology for the Capability, Skill and Service reference model defined by Plattform Industrie 4.
Authors/creators: Aljosha Köcher (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: DefectOnt
Short description: An ontology for defect detection in metal additive manufacturing.

Name: Digital Buildings Ontology
Short description: The Digital Buildings ontology is an open-source, Apache-licensed development effort to create a uniform schema for representing metadata in Google's buildings real estate portfolio. It is inspired from Project Haystack and BrickSchema.

Name: Digital Camera Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe digital cameras.

Name: Digital Construction Materials
Short description: The Material Ontology defining the main concepts of building material, type and its properties.

Name: Digital Receiver Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe televisiton digital receivers.

Name: DIN EN 61360 Ontology-Design-Pattern
Short description: Its an ontology design pattern of DIN EN 61360, which is about standard data element types with associated classification scheme (Part 1: Definitions - Principles and methods).
Authors/creators: Aljosha Köcher (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: DIN EN 62264-2 Ontology-Design-Pattern
Short description: Its an ontology design pattern of DIN EN 62264-2, which is about the continuous exchange of information between company functions such as production, planning, materials management, personnel, the control systems and the IT systems must be correct, complete and timely without delay.
Authors/creators: Aljosha Köcher,Janni Kreisberg (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: DIN 8580 Ontology-Design-Pattern
Short description: Its an ontology design pattern of DIN 8580, a German standard with a taxonomy of manufacturing processes.

Name: Dishwasher Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe dishwashers.

Name: Distribution Element Ontology
Short description: The Distribution Element Ontology provides an ontology based on the IfcDistributionElement subtree in the IFC specification, containing a taxonomy of classes that allow to define common distribution elements (actuators, flowterminals, .

Name: DogOnt: Ontology Modeling for Intelligent Domotic Environments
Short description: DogOnt is a modeling language for IEs (Intelligent Environments), based on Semantic Web technologies.

Name: Domain Mechanical Testing
Short description: A domain ontology for Mechanical Testing based on EMMO.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Daniele Toti,Gerhard Goldbeck,Joana Francisco Morgado,Yoav Nahshon

Name: Domain Mechanical Testing Chemistry
Short description: Information not available

Name: Dryer Machine Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe dryer machines.

Name: DVD Player and Blu-ray Player Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary for DVD players and blu-ray players.

Name: eClass Products and Services Ontology
Short description: This ontology provides core classes and properties derived from the products and services categorization standard eCl@ss 5.

Name: EEPSA Ontology
Short description: This ontology puts together all the ontology modules and ODPs that form the EEPSA Ontology.

Name: Elemental Multiperspective Material Ontology
Short description: Elemental Multiperspective Material Ontology is a multidisciplinary effort to develop a standard representational framework (the ontology) based on current materials modelling knowledge, including physical sciences, analytical philosophy and information and communication technologies.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: Elemental Multiperspective Material middle-level ontology
Short description: The EMMO middle-level ontology is a container for the EMMO middle level ontologies.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: equipment
Short description: Equipment ontology for Product Lifecycle Management RDL.

Name: ERA Vocabulary
Short description: This is the human and machine readable Vocabulary/Ontology governed by the European Union Agency for Railways (https://www.era.europa.eu/). It represents the concepts and relationships linked to the sectorial legal framework and the use cases under the Agency´s remit, as described in the Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) on the common specifications for the register of railway infrastructure. Currently, this vocabulary covers the European railway infrastructure and the vehicles types authorized to operate over it.

Name: European Waste Classification for Statistics
Short description: The European Waste Classification is a mainly substance oriented classification of waste for statistical purposes, which distinguishes hazardous and non-hazardous waste. It is aggregated into 51 mainly substance orientated waste categories that provides criteria for the assessment and classification of hazardous waste and defines different types of waste by a six-digit code for the waste and the respective two-digit and four-digit chapter headings.

Name: Extruder Ontology
Short description: An ontology for describing a type of manufacturing machines which perform an extrusion process (extruder).

Name: Extruder's sensors ontology
Short description: Sensor related information for ExtruOnt ontology.

Name: Facility Ontology
Short description: The COGITO Facility ontology aims at modelling facilities in the construction domain.
Authors/creators: María Poveda Villalón,Raúl García Castro,Socorro Bernardos Galindo

Name: Fridge and Freezer Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe fridges and freezers.

Name: Furniture Sector Ontology
Short description: The furniture sector ontology aims at covering the scope of the furniture industry and it has been extended according to the needs of the furniture domain to the home and furnishing arena.

Name: Game Console Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe game consoles, such as Nintendo Wii(c), Sony Playstation(c), Microsoft XBox(c).

Name: Garment Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe men's/women's shirts, dresses, skirts, trousers.

Name: General Process Ontology
Short description: This ontology aims to model processes, which are holistic perspective elements that transform inputs/educts (matter, energy, information) into output/products (matter, energy, information) with the help of tools (devices, algorithms). They can be decomposed into sub-processes and have predecessor and successor processes.

Name: GRACE Ontology
Short description: The GRACE system will act at the Distributed Control System (DCS) and Manufacturing Execution System (MES) levels, implementing the sharing of process critical information between and inside the two layers. This results in the more efficient management of resources and higher final product quality.

Name: Grid2Onto
Short description: Grid2Onto is an application ontology that describes the observations (values, indicators, physical objects, etc.) collected from a power grid.

Name: Hair Dryer Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe hair dryers (modern blow dryers only).

Name: Home Hifi Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe home hifis and other home audio entertainment devices.

Name: IEEE Standard for Autonomous Robotics Ontology
Short description: An ontology of IEEE Standard 1872.2 which is a standard to describe domain-speficic concepts and definitions used in Autonomous Robotics.
Authors/creators: Miguel Vieira da Silva (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: IFC2X3
Short description: OWL ontology for the IFC2X3 conceptual data schema and exchange file format for Building Information Model (BIM) data.

Name: IFC2X3_TC1
Short description: OWL ontology for the IFC2X3_TC1 conceptual data schema and exchange file format for Building Information Model (BIM) data.

Name: IFC4
Short description: OWL ontology for the IFC4 conceptual data schema and exchange file format for Building Information Model (BIM) data.

Name: IFC4_ADD1
Short description: OWL ontology for the IFC4_ADD1 conceptual data schema and exchange file format for Building Information Model (BIM) data.

Name: IFC4_ADD2
Short description: OWL ontology for the IFC4_ADD2 conceptual data schema and exchange file format for Building Information Model (BIM) data.

Name: Industrial Maintenance Ontology
Short description: Ontology, that covers concepts about technical, administrative and management activities and actions for maintenance information systems.

Name: IOF Core Ontology
Short description: The IOF Core Ontology contains notions found to be common across multiple manufacturing domains.

Name: International System of Quantities
Short description: Defines physical quantities in the International System of Quantities (ISQ). ISQ was made an official ISO standard in 2009 and is defined in the ISO/IEC 80000 standard.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: Industrial IoT Architecture Ontology
Short description: An ontology to describe standards related to Industry 4.0, Smart Manufacturing and IIoT.

Name: Industrial Ontologies Foundry Supply Chain Reference Ontology
Short description: Supply Chain Reference Ontology (SCRO) aims to represent the generic constructs (including classes and properties) related to the domain of supply chain and logistics with focus on consistency and interoperability across supply chain- and logistics ontologies.

Name: IoT Ontology
Short description: The COGITO IoT ontology aims at modelling IoT devices and their measurements in the construction domain.
Authors/creators: María Poveda Villalón,Raúl García Castro,Socorro Bernardos Galindo

Name: ISO 22400-2 Ontology-Design-Pattern
Short description: Its an ontology design pattern of ISO 22400-2, which presents key performance indicators (KPIs) for Manufacturing Operations Management (MOM) by terminologically standardizing various KPI-related terms, but also providing formulas for their calculation.
Authors/creators: Aljosha Köcher,Janni Kreisberg (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: Key Performance Indicator ontology
Short description: The Key Performance Indicator module aims to model the metrics defined at the beginning of building renovation activities to monitor the conformance with typical requirements related to energy efficient buildings.

Name: Landline Phones Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe all kinds of landline phones including wireless and ones with multiple base station.

Name: M3-lite Taxonomy
Short description: It is a taxonomy that enables testbeds to semantically annotate the IoT data produced by heterogeneous devices and store them in a federated datastore such as FIESTA-IoT. In this taxonomy, we classify devices, the domain of interests (health, smart home, smart kitchen, environmental monitoring, etc.), phenomena and unit of measurements.
Authors/creators: Amelie Gyrard,David Gomez,Garvita Bajaj,Jorge Lanza,Luis Sanchez,Rachit Agarwal,Tarek Elsaleh

Name: M3 Ontology
Short description: The Machine-to-Machine Measurement (M3) Ontology is a unified language, nomenclature, dictionnary which enables semantically annotating heterogeneous IoT data produced by heterogeneous devices measurements (sensors, RFID tags, etc.). We classify all devices, their measurements and the feature of interests (health, smart home, smart kitchen, environmental monitoring, etc.).

Name: Maintenance Activity Ontology
Short description: A reference ontology for maintenance activity terms which also contains a holistic view of the types of activities conducted by maintenance personnel.
Authors/creators: Caitlin Woods,Matt Selway,Tyler Bikaun,Markus Stumptner,Melinda Hodkiewicz

Name: Maintenance Activity Ontology
Short description: The Maintenance Activity Ontology is a reference ontology for maintenance activity terms. This ontology is derived from a set of 800 000 real-world maintenance work orders. .
Authors/creators: Caitlin Woods,Matt Selway,Tyler Bikaun,Markus Stumptner,Melinda Hodkiewicz

Name: Maintenance Reference Ontology
Short description: The Maintenance Reference Ontology supports modelling of concepts associated with asset reliability and maintenance management. It is relevant for data captured at the design stage of the asset life cycle (e.g. in failure modes and effects analysis) and in the operations and maintenance phase of the life cycle (e.g. asset reliability and the maintenance activities associated with delivering value from use of the assets).

Name: Manufacturing
Short description: Describes manufacturing processes with engeneered participants.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: Manufacturing Semantics Ontology
Short description: A top-level ontology in the manufacturing domain, i.e. a common ancestor for more domain-specific ontologies. This ontology addresses topic similar to earlier work by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST). They proposed a standard for interoperability in the process management chain (Process Specification Language, PSL). Although sharing the same purposes, MASON relies on up-to-date formalisms (OWL semantics) and tries to show the concrete application of such ontologies.
Authors/creators: Severin Lemaignan (probably Ali Siadat and Jean-Yves Dantan too)

Name: Manufacturing System Ontology
Short description: The MSO ontology is intended to represent manufacturing system. The MSO ontology is developed in OWL and wants to be a guideline to favour the representation of objects in production systems.

Name: ManuService Ontology
Short description: ManuService is an ontology for enabling semantic interoperability and communication within the domain of manufacturing. Aiming at solving the interoperability issue within the domain of manufacturing, ManuService consists of all necessary concepts for describing highly customized products and manufacturing resources. .

Name: Materials
Short description: The materials module populates the physicalistic perspective with materials subclasses categorised according to modern applied physical sciences.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: Materials Design Ontology
Short description: The Materials Design Ontology is designed to enable semantic query and integrated query over multiple databases. By generating mappings between MDO and the schemas of materials databases, we can create MDO-enabled query interfaces. The querying can occur, for instance, via MDO-based query expansion, MDO-based mediation or through MDO-enabled data warehouses.

Name: Material properties ontology
Short description: The Material Properties Ontology aims to provide the vocabulary to describe the building components, materials, and their corresponding properties, relevant within the construction industry. More specifically, the building elements and properties covered in this ontology support applications focused on the design of building renovation projects.

Name: Material Science and Engineering Ontology
Short description: This is the mid-level module of the Material Science and Engineering Ontology (MSEO),which utilizes the Common Core Ontology stack giving materials scientists and engineers the ability to represent their experiments and resulting data. The goal is to create machine and human readable sematic data which can be easily digested by other science domains.

Name: Mechanical Testing Ontology (MTO)
Short description: The materials mechanical testing ontology (MTO) was developed by collecting the mechanical testing vocabulary from ISO 23718 standard, as well as the standardized testing processes described for various mechanical testing of materials like tensile testing, Brinell hardness test, Vickers hardness test, stress relaxation test, and fatigue testing.
Authors/creators: Birgit Skrotzki,Hossein Beygi Nasrabadi,Miriam Eisenbart,Thomas Hanke

Name: Microstructure domain ontology
Short description: The Microstructure Domain Ontology is intended to be a domain ontology for physical metallurgy. The intension is to cover all relevant aspect of metallic microstructures.
Authors/creators: Astrid Marthinsen,Georg J. Schmitz,Jesper Friis,Sylvain Gouttebroze,Tomas Manik,Ulrike Cihak-Bayr

Name: Microwave Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe microwave ovens.

Name: Mobile Phone Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe mobile phones and smartphones.

Name: Modem Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe cable modems, DSL routers, wireless access points.

Name: Molecules And Materials Basic Ontology
Short description: It is a domain ontology for molecular materials.

Name: MPS500
Short description: A semantic capability model of all MPS500 modules.
Authors/creators: Aljosha Köcher (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: MPS500 AssembleCylinder
Short description: Information not available
Authors/creators: Aljosha Köcher (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: MPS500 AssembleThermometer
Short description: Information not available
Authors/creators: Aljosha Köcher (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: MPS500 CameraModule
Short description: Information not available
Authors/creators: Aljosha Köcher,Miguel Vieira da Silva (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: MPS500 DrillingModule
Short description: Information not available
Authors/creators: Aljosha Köcher,Miguel Vieira da Silva (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: MPS500 PropertyTypes
Short description: A little ontology that contains all property type definitions used for MPS500.
Authors/creators: Aljosha Köcher,Miguel Vieira da Silva (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: MPS500 RawCylinderSupplyModule
Short description: Information not available
Authors/creators: Aljosha Köcher (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: MPS500 RawThermometerSupplyModule
Short description: Information not available
Authors/creators: Aljosha Köcher,Miguel Vieira da Silva (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: MPS500 ShippingModule
Short description: Information not available
Authors/creators: Aljosha Köcher (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: MPS500 StorageModule PutInStorage
Short description: Information not available
Authors/creators: Aljosha Köcher (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: MPS500 StorageModule RetrieveFromStorage
Short description: Information not available
Authors/creators: Aljosha Köcher (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: MPS500 Transport Module
Short description: Information not available
Authors/creators: Aljosha Köcher (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: MSDL (Manufacturing Service Description Language)
Short description: Manufacturing Service Description Language (MSDL) is an OWL-based ontology developed for the formal representation of manufacturing services.

Name: Navigation Device Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe navigation devices.

Name: Occupancy Profile ontology
Short description: The Occupancy Profile ontology has been developed to represent and define occupancy profiles in building spaces.
Authors/creators: María Poveda Villalón,Raúl García Castro,Serge Chávez Feria,Ontology Engineering Group

Name: oneM2M Base Ontology
Short description: oneM2M Base Ontology is the minimal ontology (i.e. mandating the least number of conventions) that is required such that other ontologies can be mapped into oneM2M.

Name: Ontology for Maintenance Procedure Documentation (OMPD) Conditional Maintenance Task Ontology
Short description: The OMPD Conditional Maintenance Task Ontology captures functional failures and corrective maintenance tasks (to be conditionally executed on the occurrence of a function failure) found in some industrial maintenance procedures.
Authors/creators: University of Western Australia,Equonto Pty. Ltd.

Name: Ontology for the Battery Value Chain
Short description: Ontology, aiming on modeling processes along the Battery value chain. Processes are holistic perspective elements that transform inputs/educts (matter, energy, information) into output/products (matter, energy, information) with the help of tools (devices, algorithms).

Name: Ontology model for Web of Things
Short description: This ontology aims to model the Web of Things domain according to the W3C Interest Group (http://w3c.github.io/wot/).

Name: Ontology of units of Measure
Short description: The Ontology of units of Measure (OM) 2.0 models concepts and relations important to scientific research.

Name: OntoSensor Device Ontology
Short description: Ontology copied for safe-keeping; reference original rather than this copy.

Name: OPC UA Core ontology
Short description: Ontology for representing information about Semantic Digital Twins of Manufacturing Resources (OPC UA context).

Name: OPC UA NodeSet ontology
Short description: Ontology for representing information about Semantic Digital Twins of Manufacturing Resources (OPC UA context).

Name: OPC UA Ontology-Design-Pattern
Short description: This ontology is based on OpcUaNodeset-Ontology (from fortiss),just a couple of things were edited because authors are using this ontology in an execution environment.

Name: OpenADR ontology
Short description: This ontology describes the openADR protocol based on the documentation provided by the openADR Profile B.

Name: OpenLink Product Features Ontology
Short description: Ontology that defines entity and relation types used to describe product features.

Name: Open Energy Ontology
Short description: The Open Energy Ontology is an ontology for all aspects of the energy modelling domain.
Authors/creators: Lukas Emele,Mirjam Stappel,Anna Kleinau,Janna Hastings,Vera Sehn,Hannah Förster,Patrick Kuckertz,Carsten Hoyer-Klick,Christian Hofmann,Kevin Knosala,Ludwig Hülk,Izzet Kilicarslan,Franziska Drathschmidt,Simon Flügel,Ulrich Frey,Christoph Muschner,Christian Winger,Fabian Neuhaus,Lara Christmann,Martin Glauer,Pierre-Francois Duc,Sebastian Cordes,Michaja Pehl,Kai Schnepf,Till Mossakowski,Alexander Stage,Hedda Gardian,Eugenio Salvador Arellano Ruiz,Markus Rothkötter,Linda Rülicke,Alexandra Seibicke,Ludwig Mittermeier,Ulf Müller,Nele Köhler,Hannah Spinde,Viktor Wichern

Name: PackML StateMachine Ontology-Design-Pattern
Short description: Its an ontology design pattern of PackML which is a common standard defining an abstract machine behavior.
Authors/creators: Aljosha Köcher,Janni Kreisberg,Tom Westermann (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: Paper Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe various types of paper products (office paper, photo paper, etc.).

Name: PCA 'Part 14' upper ontology
Short description: The POSC Caesar Association (PCA) 'Part 14' upper ontology is an OWL 2 DL rendering of the ISO 15926-2 data model. ISO 15926-2 specifies a conceptual data model for computer representation of technical information about process plants.

Name: Platform Ontology
Short description: The COGITO Platfrom ontology aims at modelling the entities considered in the the Digital Twin Platform, a component of the COGITO architecture.
Authors/creators: María Poveda Villalón,Raúl García Castro,Socorro Bernardos Galindo

Name: Portable Media Player Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe portable media players.

Name: Position Ontology
Short description: It extends SUMO and complements CORA and was developed for capturing the main concepts and relations underlying the notions of position, orientation and pose.
Authors/creators: IEEE RAS Ontology for Robotics and Automation Working Group (IEEE RAS ORA WG)

Name: Printer Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe home and office printers including all-in-one devices with faxing, scanning and copying capabilities.

Name: process
Short description: Process ontology for Product Lifecycle Management RDL. Includes unit operations, reaction, transport.

Name: Process Ontology
Short description: The COGITO Process ontology aims at modelling the construction process.
Authors/creators: María Poveda Villalón,Raúl García Castro,Socorro Bernardos Galindo

Name: Product Ontology
Short description: PRONTO (PRoduct ONTOlogy) is an ontology for the Product Modelling domain, able to efficiently handle product variants, which defines and integrates two hierarchies to represent product information: the Abstraction Hierarchy (AH) and the Structural one (SH).

Name: Product Types Ontology
Short description: This service provides ca. 300, 000 precise definitions for types of product or services that extend the schema.org and GoodRelations standards for e-commerce markup. NOTE: in the related RDF file only the 1000 most frequently request classes of the related service!.

Name: Product Vocabulary
Short description: ProVoc (Product Vocabulary) is a vocabulary that can be used to represent information and manipulate them through the Web.

Name: PSS Ontology
Short description: The Product Service System (PSS) working group (WG) under Industrial Ontology Foundry aims to create a basis ontology for enhancing the engineering of PSS in manufacturing, by modelling all the aspects that affect, or could affect a PSS.

Name: RealEstateCore Full
Short description: Its an OWL 2 ontology which enables data integration for smart buildings.

Name: Reference Generalized Ontological Model
Short description: Reference Generalized Ontological Model is a Smart Manufacturing ontology that provides a detailed unified model which takes the I4.0 domain knowledge from rawmaterial to finished product including supply to the customeras well as monitoring the different situations of machines and processes.

Name: Reified Requirements Ontology
Short description: The Reified Requirements Ontology provides classes and relations for representing requirements as OWL individuals.

Name: Resistance Spot Welding Ontology
Short description: We propose Resistance Spot Welding Ontology (RSWO) to formalize knowledge in the RSW domain. It combines three sources of knowledge: extensive discussions with Bosch welding experts; reusing terminologies following ISO-14327 and ISO-14373 standards; and existing established ontologies. We have assessed RSWO on real-world data from monitoring welding quality at Bosch in Germany.

Name: RESPOND Ontology
Short description: The RESPOND project aims to deploy an interoperable energy automation, monitoring and control solution to deliver DR programs at a dwelling, building and district level.

Name: RFID System Configuration Ontology
Short description: Its purpose is to aid the identification and configuration of the right RFID system, reader or tag based on the requirements of the end-user, who can be either an RFID expert or a non-expert.
Authors/creators: Eleni Tsalapati,James Tribe,Paul A. Goodall,Robert I. Young,Thomas W. Jackson,Andrew A. West

Name: RIVA InfoModel
Short description: An information model for autonomous mobile robots.

Name: Resource, Material, Process, Function and Quality (rmpfq) ontology
Short description: This is a domain-level ontology focusing on the quality related factors during manufacturing processes. It is based on the IOF:Core middle-level ontology and the BFO top-level ontology.

Name: ROMAIN: Reference Ontology for industrial Maintenance
Short description: ROMAIN is domain-specific, open access, reference ontology for maintenance management domain, with the scope to the classes that are unique to the maintenance management practice, such as maintenance strategy, degradation, and work order management, rather than modelling the entire domain of maintenance.

Name: RPARTS
Short description: It was developed to provide concepts for CORA ontology to model robotic parts.
Authors/creators: IEEE RAS Ontology for Robotics and Automation Working Group (IEEE RAS ORA WG)

Name: Safety Ontology
Short description: This is an ontology for extracting the safety knowledge in industry 4.0.

Name: Safety Ontology
Short description: The COGITO Safety ontology aims at modelling the safety of the construction domain.
Authors/creators: María Poveda Villalón,Raúl García Castro,Socorro Bernardos Galindo

Name: SAREF Ontology
Short description: The Smart Applications REFerence ontology (SAREF) is intended to enable interoperability between solutions from different providers and among various activity sectors in the Internet of Things (IoT),thus contributing to the development of the global digital market.

Name: SAREF extension for the Automotive domain
Short description: SAREF4AUTO is an extension of SAREF to connect it with existing ontologies (e.g. W3C SSN, W3C SOSA, GeoSPARQL etc.) and important standardization initiatives and ontologies in the Automotive domain.

Name: SAREF extension for building
Short description: SAREF4BLDG is an extension of the SAREF ontology that was created based on the Industry Foundation Classes (IFC) standard for building information.

Name: SAREF extension for the Energy domain
Short description: SAREF4ENER is an extension of SAREF for the Energy domain and focuses on demand response scenarios, in which customers can offer flexibility to the Smart Grid to manage their smart home devices by means of a Customer Energy Manager (CEM).

Name: SAREF extension for the electric grid domain
Short description: SAREF4GRID is an extension of SAREF for the smart grid domain.

Name: SAREF extension for the industry and manufacturing domain
Short description: SAREF4INMA is an extension of SAREF for the industry and manufacturing domain to solve the lack of interoperability between various types of production equipment that produce items in a factory and, once outside the factory, between different organizations in the value chain to uniquely track back the produced items to the corresponding production equipment, batches, material and precise time in which they were manufactured.
Authors/creators: Laura Daniele,Alba Fernandez Izquierdo,Raúl Garcia-Castro,Mike de Roode

Name: SAREF extension for the smart lifts domain
Short description: SAREF4LIFT is an extension of SAREF for the Smart Lifts domain.
Authors/creators: Maxime Lefrançois,Mauro Dragoni,Alba Fernandez Izquierdo,Raúl Garcia-Castro

Name: SAREF4SYST: an extension of SAREF for typology of systems and their inter-connections
Short description: The present document specifies a new reference ontology pattern for the SAREF semantic model and it also defines how this pattern may be instantiated for the verticals, and point to examples for the Smart Energy and the Smart Building domains.

Name: SAREF4WATR is an extension of SAREF for Water
Short description: This ontology extends the SAREF ontology for the Water domain.

Name: SCOPRO (Supply Chain Process Ontology)
Short description: SCOPRO (Supply Chain Process Ontology) is a subontology of SCONTO (Supply Chain Ontology), which is an ontology that formally describes a supply chain (SC) based on the SCOR de facto standard. SCOPRO formalizes the SC essential concepts, capturing the organizational units participating in a supply chain, its structure, and business processes. It represents the SC business processes at various abstraction levels and their associated resources in a holistic fashion.
Authors/creators: Gabriela P. Henning,Horacio P. Leone,Marcela Vegetti,Alicia C. Böhm

Name: SCORVoc
Short description: A vocabulary which represents the Supply Chain Operations Reference (SCOR) standard.

Name: SEAS Architecture ontology
Short description: The SEAS Architecture Ontology models the concepts from the SRAM (Static random-access memory) Architecture model.

Name: SEAS Building Ontology
Short description: The SEAS Building ontology describes a taxonomy of buildings, building spaces, and rooms.

Name: SEAS Device ontology
Short description: The SEAS Device ontology defines `seas:Device` as physical system that are designed to execute one or more procedures that involve the physical world.

Name: SEAS Electric Light Source Ontology
Short description: The SEAS Electric Light source ontology describes Electric light sources.

Name: SEAS Electric Power System Ontology
Short description: The SEAS Electric Power System Vocabulary defines: Electric power systems that consume, produce, or store electricity, electrical connections between electric power systems, where electricity is exchanged, and electrical connection. Points of electric power systems, through which electricity flows in/out the power systems.

Name: SEAS Electric Street Light System Ontology
Short description: The SEAS Electric Street Light System ontology describes Electric Street Light Systems.

Name: SEAS Electric Vehicle ontology
Short description: The SEAS Electric Vehicle Vocabulary defines features of interest for electric vehicles and their charging equipments.

Name: SEAS Photovoltaic ontology
Short description: The SEAS PhotovoltaicOntology Ontology describes solar panels and its components as electric power systems.

Name: SEAS Smart Meter ontology
Short description: The SEAS Smart Meter ontology defines seas:SmartMeter as physical system (seas:Sensor) that are designed to Compute Metering on different amount of matter, such as Natural Gas, Water and Electricity. Smart Meters are connected systems which are able to send metering evaluation to some managing systems.

Name: SEAS Thermodynamic System ontology
Short description: The SEAS Thermodynamic System ontology defines systems that may exchange heat.

Name: Semantic Sensor Network Ontology
Short description: It is an ontology for describing sensors and their observations, the involved procedures, the studied features of interest, the samples used to do so and the observed properties as well as actuators.
Authors/creators: W3C Spatial Data on the Web Working Group

Name: Semantically Integrated Planning Model
Short description: An ontology providing semantics for capturing the knowledge of manufacturing process planning.

Name: Sensor Data ontology
Short description: The Sensor Data ontology has been developed to represent measurements generated by sensors located inside building spaces.

Name: Sensor, Observation, Sample and Actuator
Short description: It provides a formal and general-purpose specification for modelling the interaction between the entities involved in the acts of observation, actuation and sampling.
Authors/creators: W3C/OGC Spatial Data on the Web Working Group

Name: Sharework Ontology for Human-Robot Collaboration
Short description: The SOHO ontology describes Human-Robot Collaboration Scenarios in Manufacturing. It pursues a context-based approach characterizing knowledge from different synergetic perspectives: (i) Environment context; (ii) Behavior context; (iii) Production context. The combination of these contexts supports a contextual and flexible interpretation of environment states, skills of cobots and workers and, production events.

Name: Shaver Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe shavers, epilators.

Name: Shoe Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to represent the product type Shoe in the context of the OPDM project: (1) Fashion & Accessories Shoes. Defined by shoes for men, ladies and kids for all occasions. (2) Leisure & Sporting Goods Sport shoes. Implies all kind of sport shoes like trainers, running shoes, flip flops, skate shoes, football and hiking boots.

Name: Shredder Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to represent various types of shredder devices.

Name: SmartHomeWeather
Short description: A ontology defining weather-related concepts and properties being relevant to smart home systems that provide predictive control.

Name: SmartProducts EADS
Short description: Defines concepts and properties specific for the EADS use case (aircraft assembly).

Name: SmartProducts Generic model
Short description: Specifically describes spatial context.

Name: SmartProducts Product model
Short description: Contains scenario-independent concepts and properties related to products and their parts.

Name: Statistical classification of products by activity
Short description: CPA 2.1 is the European version of the CPC 2.1 (Central Product Classifications of the United Nations) and with a structure based on NACE 2 according to the criterion of economic origin (and thus the definition of the economic activities).

Name: Storage Media Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe hard disk drives, solid-state drives, USB flash drives, memory cards.

Name: Tablet PC Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe tablet PCs.

Name: Television Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe TV sets.

Name: Top Level Ontology of Ontology-based-InformationFlow-Industry-40
Short description: Combines existing concepts of established vocabularies (such as SSN),but not only uses those concepts to build a robust top-level starting point, but extends them by enhancing the ontology with core-concepts of manufacturing-related terms.

Name: Units of measure (uom)
Short description: Unit of measure ontology for Product Lifecycle Management RDL.

Name: Utility vocabulary of OPDM Category Scheme based on the taxonomy of product types defined by Google
Short description: A utility RDF vocabulary for the taxonomy of product types defined by Google needed across all Product Type Ontologies (PTOs) in OPDM. The Google categories of product types is available online at http://www.google.com/basepages/producttype/taxonomy.en-US.txt.
Authors/creators: E-Business and Web Science Research Group (http://www.unibw.de/ebusiness/)

Name: Vacuum Cleaner Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe vacuum cleaners.

Name: VDI 2206 Ontology-Design-Pattern
Short description: An ontology of a section of VDI guideline 2206 that contains a lightweight model to describe the abstract structure of machines.
Authors/creators: Janni Kreisberg (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: VDI 2860 Ontology-Design-Pattern
Short description: An ontology design pattern of VDI guideline 2860 which describes handling operations and the way they are made up of atomic actions.
Authors/creators: Janni Kreisberg,Aljosha Köcher (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: VDI 3682 Ontology-Design-Pattern
Short description: An ontology design pattern of VDI guideline 3682 which contains Formalized Process Descripion, a very lightweight way to describe processes in general.
Authors/creators: Aljosha Köcher,Miguel Vieira da Silva,Janni Kreisberg (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: VDI 5100 Ontology-Design-Pattern
Short description: An ontology design pattern of the industrial standard VDI 5100, a System Architecture for Intralogistics (SAIL).
Authors/creators: Tom Westermann (via Git commits, might be incomplete)

Name: VDI VDE NAMUR 2658
Short description: Probably an ontology about automation engineering of modular systems in the process industry (source: https://www.vdi.de/richtlinien/details/vdivdenamur-2658-blatt-1-automatisierungstechnisches-engineering-modularer-anlagen-in-der-prozessindustrie-allgemeines-konzept-und-schnittstellen).

Name: Vehicle Sales Ontology for Semantic Web-based E-Commerce
Short description: The Vehicle Sales Ontology is a Web vocabulary for describings cars, boats, bikes and other vehicles for e-commerce.

Name: Versioning Ontology
Short description: VERONTO is an ontology to manage the information change of family product in time through versioning during its life cycle.

Name: Vicinity core model
Short description: This ontology represent the core terms to allow interoperability in an IoT context based on VICINITY technological solutions.
Authors/creators: María Poveda Villalón,Raúl García Castro,Fernando Serena

Name: Video Camera Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe camcorders.

Name: Video Projectors Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe video projectors.

Name: Virtual Asset Representation Ontology
Short description: The VAR Ontology enables the data exchange between different agents in assembly scenarios to enable adaptive, interactive, assistive and collaborative workplaces.

Name: visualization4ExtruOnt
Short description: A Sensor4ExtruOnt module to represent the different types of visualizations for the sensor's data.
Authors/creators: BDI - Interoperable Databases GroupUniversity of the Basque Country UPV/EHU

Name: Volkswagen Vehicles Ontology
Short description: A vocabulary for describing Volkswagen-specific features of automobiles and their components.

Name: Washer Machine Vocabulary
Short description: Vocabulary to describe washing machines.

Name: Waste Categories
Short description: Waste categories are defined on the basis of the statistical European Waste Classification (EWC-Stat), which is a substance-oriented nomenclature and which has been specially created for EU waste statistics. The 51 waste categories that must be reported in waste generation include 21 hazardous waste categories and 30 non-hazardous waste categories.

Name: WoT Digital Twin Ontology
Short description: Digital Twin ontology used to define Digital Twins and Semantic Digital Twins by dimensions using Web of Things.

Name: Z-BRE4K semantic model
Short description: The Z-BRE4K semantic model in the form of ontology is designed to serve as a common reference model for annotation and description of knowledge to represent manufacturing system performance.

Name: AffectedBy Ontology-Design-Pattern
Short description: The AffectedBy ODP consists of two classes aff:FeatureOfInterest and aff:Quality; and three properties aff:influencedBy, aff:belongsTo, and aff:affectedBy.

Name: Annotation (IEEE1872)
Short description: Ontology for annotation properties used in IEEE1872-owl.

Name: Annotations
Short description: Defines annotations used in EMMO Ontology.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: Atomistic
Short description: An EMMO-based domain ontology for atomistic and electronic modelling.

Name: Basic Access Control ontology
Short description: Defines the class Authorization and its essential properties, and also some classes of access such as read and write.

Name: Bibliographic Ontology
Short description: A Semantic Web vocabulary for expressing citations and bibliographic references.

Name: BFO 2020
Short description: Basic Formal Ontology implemented in the Web Ontology Language (OWL 2) with direct semantics.
Authors/creators: Ana Teresa Correia,Arkopaul Sarkar,Barry Smith,Boonserm Kulvatunyou,Chris Will,Dusan Sormaz,Elisa Kendall,Farhad Ameri,Jim Logan,Melinda Hodkiewicz,Milos Drobnjakovic,Will Sobel (no creators,but long contributors list)

Name: BIO: A vocabulary for biographical information
Short description: This document describes a vocabulary for describing biographical information about people, both living and dead.

Name: Concepts to be moved to EMMO
Short description: Information not available
Authors/creators: Astrid Marthinsen,Georg J. Schmitz,Jesper Friis,Sylvain Gouttebroze,Tomas Manik,Ulrike Cihak-Bayr

Name: Citation Typing Ontology
Short description: Ontology written in OWL 2 DL to enable characterization of the nature or type of citations, both factually and rhetorically, and to permit these descriptions to be published on the Web.

Name: Creative Commons (webresourceorg/cc/)
Short description: The CC schema lets you describe copyright licenses in RDF.

Name: Creative Commons (creativecommonsorg)
Short description: The Creative Commons Rights Expression Language (ccREL) lets you describe copyright licenses in RDF.

Name: Data Catalog Vocabulary
Short description: DCAT is an RDF vocabulary designed to facilitate interoperability between data catalogs published on the Web.
Authors/creators: Riccardo Albertoni,David Browning,Simon Cox,Alejandra Gonzalez Beltran,Andrea Perego,Peter Winstanley and further contributors

Name: Datatype Ontology
Short description: Information not available

Name: Digital Construction Agents
Short description: Agents ontology formalize the representation of the actors and stakeholders over the construction lifecycle, to support data sharing of the social, organizational and contractural relations.

Name: Digital Construction Contexts
Short description: Context ontology provides the basic representation mechanisms for multi-context information present in all contruction and renovation projects, including planned and actual values, as-designed and as-built models, and different levels of detail/development.

Name: Digital Construction Energy
Short description: An ontology for energy systems and energy efficiency in the construction and renovation domain.

Name: Digital Construction Entities
Short description: Digital Construction Entities Ontology defines the basic classes and properties needed for the representation of construction and renovation projects.

Name: Digital Construction Information
Short description: Digital Construction Information ontology defines the representation of information content entities in construction and renovation, including models, plans, scenarios, messages, issues, videos and point clouds.

Name: Digital Construction Lifecycle
Short description: An ontology to represent the enhancement of building data throughout the construction lifecycle stages.

Name: Digital Construction Materials
Short description: The Material Ontology defining the main concepts of building material, type and its properties.

Name: Digital Construction Occupancy
Short description: Digital Construction Occupancy ontology represents those aspects of construction and renovation projects that concern the comfort, safety and health of occupants, including visual and thermal comfort, indoor air quality and building acoustics, as well as related sensor observations.

Name: Digital Construction Processes
Short description: Processes ontology defines the concepts and relations for activities and resources.

Name: Digital Construction Units
Short description: Digital Construction Units vocabulary defines units and quantity kinds that are specific to construction and renovation projects, for instance, concerning energy simulation results.

Name: Digital Construction Variables
Short description: Ontology of properties, property states, measurements, constraints, and values.

Name: DOAP vocabulary
Short description: The Description of a Project (DOAP) vocabulary, described using W3C RDF Schema and the Web Ontology Language.

Name: DOLCE+DnS Ultralite
Short description: It is a simplification of some parts of the DOLCE Lite-Plus library (cf. http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/dul/DLP397.owl).
Authors/creators: Aldo Gangemi (There could be further creators)

Name: Dublin Core extensions of the W3C Provenance Interchange Ontology (PROV-O)
Short description: It describes a partial mapping from Dublin Core Terms to the PROV-O OWL2 ontology.

Name: Dublin Core Metadata Element Set
Short description: Dublin Core is a set of fifteen main metadata items for describing digital or physical resources.

Name: Dublin Core Metadata Terms
Short description: Dublin Core is a set of fifteen main metadata items for describing digital or physical resources.

Name: EMMO cif_core
Short description: CIF core ontology generated from the CIF core definitions at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/COMCIFS/cif_core/master/.

Name: EMMO inferred chemistry2
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: EMMO top-level ontology
Short description: The EMMO top module is a container for EMMO top-level ontology.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: Encyclopedia of Life Ontology
Short description: This is the initial vocabulary for the Encyclopedia of Life Linked Open Data Set.

Name: Execution-Executor-Procedure Ontology-Design-Pattern
Short description: The Execution-Executor-Procedure (EEP) ODP extends the AffectedBy ODP to support data analysts making further queries to discover sensors or actuators that observe or act on a given property of a space.

Name: Execution ontology module for the EEPSA Ontology
Short description: This ontology module describes the Execution terminology under the eep:Execution class for the EEPSA Ontology.

Name: Executor ontology module for the EEPSA Ontology
Short description: This ontology module describes the Executor terminology under the eep:Executor class for the EEPSA Ontology.

Name: Expert Knowledge module for the EEPSA Ontology
Short description: This ontology module covers the expert knowledge for the EEPSA Ontology.

Name: Expression of Core FRBR Concepts in RDF
Short description: This vocabulary is an expression in RDF of the concepts and relations described in the IFLA report on the Functional Requirements for Bibliographic Records (FRBR).

Name: Extensible Markup Language
Short description: XML is a markup language and file format for storing,transmitting,and reconstructing arbitrary data.
Authors/creators: Tim Bray,Jean Paoli,Michael Sperberg-McQueen,Eve Maler,François Yergeau,John W. Cowan

Name: Extensible Markup Language Schema
Short description: XML Schema specifies how to formally describe the elements in an Extensible Markup Language (XML) document.
Authors/creators: Shudi (Sandy) Gao 高殊镝,C. M. Sperberg-McQueen,Henry S. Thompson

Name: Feature of Interest module for the EEPSA Ontology
Short description: This ontology module describes the Feature of Interest terminology under the aff:FeatureOfInterest class for the EEPSA Ontology.

Name: Friend of a Friend
Short description: FOAF is a project devoted to linking people and information using the Web.

Name: OBO Format Metamodel
Short description: OBO Format metamodel, which is a meta-ontology and therefore self-describing.

Name: GeoSPARQL Ontology
Short description: An RDF/OWL vocabulary for representing spatial information.

Name: GeoSPARQL Extension geo4ExtruOnt
Short description: Submodule from GeoSPARQL: An RDF/OWL vocabulary for representing spatial information.

Name: Holistic
Short description: Defines the holistic perspective which include process and the role of its participants.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: IEEE 1872 Annotation
Short description: Ontology for annotation properties used in IEEE1872-owl.

Name: Information Artifact Ontology
Short description: This ontology contains information entities, originally driven by work by the OBI digital entity and realizable information entity branch.
Authors/creators: Adam Goldstein,Alan Ruttenberg,Albert Goldfain,Barry Smith,Bjoern Peters,Carlo Torniai,Chris Mungall,Chris Stoeckert,Christian A. Boelling,Clint Dowland,Darren Natale,David Osumi-Sutherland,Gwen Frishkoff,Holger Stenzhorn,James A. Overton,James Malone,Jennifer Fostel,Jie Zheng,Jonathan Rees,Larisa Soldatova,Lawrence Hunter,Mathias Brochhausen,Matt Brush,Melanie Courtot,Michel Dumontier,Paolo Ciccarese,Pat Hayes,Philippe Rocca-Serra,Randy Dipert,Ron Rudnicki,Satya Sahoo,Sivaram Arabandi,Werner Ceusters,William Duncan,William Hogan,Yongqun (Oliver) He

Name: IOF Annotation Vocabulary
Short description: The IOF Annotation Vocabulary provides a set of OWL annotation properties for annotating IOF or other content with metadata to facilitate user and ontology developer understanding.
Authors/creators: Evan Wallace,Todd Schneider,IOF Technical Oversight Board (TOB)

Name: Mappings ontology
Short description: A small EMMO-based ontology focusing mappings data to domains and ontological concepts.

Name: Math
Short description: The math module defines the formal language of mathematics.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: Measurement Units Ontology
Short description: Classes and properties of this ontology have been designed by the MyMobileWeb project. Since the original MUO ontology (http://http://purl.oclc.org/NET/muo/muo) is not available, this is a temporary and self-hosted copy.

Name: Mereotopology
Short description: Introduces the fundamental mereotopological concepts of EMMO and their relations with the real world objects that they represent.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: Metadata for Ontology Description and publication
Short description: Information not available

Name: Metrology
Short description: Defines the formal language of metrology, including theoretical and practical aspects of measurements.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: Models
Short description: The models module defines models as semiotic signs that stands for an object by resembling or imitating it, in shape or by sharing a similar logical structure.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: Naturopathy Knowledge Graph (Ontology and Dataset)
Short description: The Naturopathy Knowledge Graph (Ontology and Dataset) describes relationships between foods, their nutrients, their color, mood, diseases, diets, and allergies.

Name: Ontology for vCard
Short description: Ontology for vCard based on RFC6350.

Name: OPDM Utility Vocabulary
Short description: An RDF vocabulary for the utility conceptual elements needed across all Product Type Ontologies (PTOs) that conform the project Ontology-based Product Data Management (OPDM) .

Name: OpenLink ACL Ontology
Short description: Ontology that defines entity and relation types used to describe conditional ACL groups and application realms. Examples include static group, contidional group, recursive authorization etc.

Name: OpenLink Product Licenses Ontology
Short description: Ontology that defines entity and relation types used to describe product licenses.

Name: OpenLink Software Ontology
Short description: Ontology that defines entity and relation types used to describe software.

Name: OpenLink Sponger Cartridges Ontology
Short description: Ontology that defines entity and relation types used to describe Sponger Cartridges.

Name: OpenLink Web Services Ontology
Short description: Ontology that defines entity and relation types used to describe web services, examples include web services, uri templates, uri parameters etc.

Name: Ordinal
Short description: The ordinal module defines ordering based on direct parthood.

Name: Organization Ontology
Short description: Vocabulary for describing organizational structures, specializable to a broad variety of types of organization.
Authors/creators: Dave Reynolds,Dominique Guardiola,Antonio Maccioni,Giorgia Lodi,Shuji Kamitsuna,Guadalupe Aguado de Cea,Elena Montiel Ponsoda,Olga Ximena Giraldo,María Poveda Villalón

Name: OWL-Time
Short description: OWL-Time is an OWL-2 DL ontology of temporal concepts, for describing the temporal properties of resources in the world or described in Web pages.

Name: PartOf
Short description: Ontology design pattern to represent entities and their parts.

Name: PAV - Provenance, Authoring and Versioning
Short description: PAV is a lightweight ontology for tracking Provenance, Authoring and Versioning.

Name: Perceptual
Short description: Defines the perceptual perspective, which which categorises real world objects according to how they are percieved by an user as a recognisable pattern in space or time.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: Perspective
Short description: The perspective module provides the practical implementation of the EMMO pluralistic approach for which the only objective categorization is provided by the Universe individual and all the Quantum individuals.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: Physical
Short description: Defines Physical, which is the superclass for all real world objects and its complement, Void.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: Physicalistic
Short description: Defines the root of the physicalistic perspective that introduces the concept of real world objects that have a meaning for the ontologist under an applied physics perspective.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: Procedure Execution ontology
Short description: The Procedure Execution ontology (PEP) defines `pep:ProcedureExecutor`s that implement `pep:Procedure` methods, and generate `pep:ProcedureExecution` activities.

Name: Procedure ontology module for the EEPSA Ontology
Short description: This ontology module describes the Procedure terminology under the eep:Procedure class for the EEPSA Ontology.

Name: Properties
Short description: Defines properties as the result of an observation process.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: Protégé
Short description: Information not available

Name: PROV Namespace
Short description: The namespace http://www.w3.org/ns/prov# is intended for use with the PROV family of documents that support the interchange of provenance on the web.

Name: QUDT Decimal Prefixes
Short description: The Prefixes vocabulary defines the prefixes commonly prepended to units to connote multiplication, either decimal or binary.

Name: QUDT Dimension Vectors
Short description: QUDT Dimension Vectors is a vocabulary that extends QUDT Quantity Kinds with properties that support dimensional analysis.

Name: QUDT Functions Extension
Short description: QUDT function extenstion.

Name: QUDT Physical Constants
Short description: The Constants vocabulary defines terms for and contains the values and standard uncertainties of physical constants, initially populated from the NIST website: The NIST Reference on Constants, Units, and Uncertainty, at http://physics.nist.gov/cuu/index.html.

Name: QUDT Quantity Kind Vocabulary
Short description: Provides the set of all quantity kinds.

Name: QUDT Systems of Units
Short description: QUDT Systems of Units Vocabulary.

Name: QUDT Schema
Short description: The QUDT, or ‘Quantity, Unit, Dimension and Type’ schema defines the base classes properties, and restrictions used for modeling physical quantities, units of measure, and their dimensions in various measurement systems.

Name: QUDT SCHEMA Facade graph
Short description: Facade graph for single place to redirect QUDT schema imports.

Name: QUDT Systems of Quantity Kinds
Short description: QUDT Systems of Quantity Kinds Vocabulary .

Name: QUDT Units of Measure
Short description: Standard units of measure for all units.

Name: Reductionistic
Short description: Defines the reductionistic perspective, which uses the fundamental non-transitive parthood relation, called direct parthood, to provide a powerful granularity description of multiscale real world objects.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: Resource Description Framework Concepts Vocabulary
Short description: This is the RDF Schema for the RDF vocabulary terms in the RDF Namespace, defined in RDF 1.1 Concepts.

Name: Resource Description Framework Schema Vocabulary
Short description: RDFS is set of classes with certain properties using the RDF extensible knowledge representation data model, providing basic elements for the description of ontologies.

Name: Result-Context Ontology-Design-Pattern
Short description: The Result-Context ODP consists of a class eep:Execution (defined in the EEP ODP) and five properties that represent its context in terms of the result (rc:hasResult and rc:hasSimpleResult), temporal context (rc:hasGenerationTime and cp:hasTemporalContext) and spatial context (rc:hasSpatialContext).

Name: SEAS Ontology
Short description: The main SEAS ontology glues together all of the SEAS modules.

Name: SEAS Battery Ontology
Short description: This ontology defines batteries and their state of charge ratio property.

Name: SEAS Boolean Property Ontology
Short description: This ontology applies the design patterns defined in the Feature of Interest ontology and the Evaluation ontology for boolean-valued properties.

Name: SEAS City Ontology
Short description: The SEAS City ontology contains subclasses of zones usefull to describe cities.

Name: SEAS Energy Form vocabulary
Short description: This vocabulary defines the forms of energy.

Name: SEAS Evaluation ontology
Short description: The Evaluation ontology describes evaluation of seas:Propertyies. There may be: direct evaluations, or qualified evaluations.

Name: SEAS Failable System ontology
Short description: The SEAS Failable System ontology defines properties to qualify features of interest, their failures and repairs.

Name: SEAS Feature of Interest ontology
Short description: This ontology defines feature of interest and their properties, as an extension of the core classes of the SSN ontology.

Name: SEAS Flexibility ontology
Short description: The SEAS Flexibility ontology defines evaluation sub types to interpret evaluations of controllable properties.

Name: SEAS Forecasting ontology
Short description: The SEAS Forecasting ontology extends the Procedure Execution ontology (https://w3id.org/pep/).

Name: SEAS Generic Property ontology
Short description: The SEAS Generic Property ontology defines the different categories of Generic Properties we can met in different domains. Such as Temperature, Speed, length…. These properties are dependants entities: they are inherent in some entity and that cannot exist without this entity.

Name: SEAS Green KPI ontology
Short description: The SEAS Green KPI ontology defines KPI properties for the energy domain.

Name: SEAS Offering ontology
Short description: The SEAS Offering ontology defines offerings and transactions between players.

Name: SEAS OptimizationProcedure ontology
Short description: The SEAS OptimizationProcedure ontology extends the Procedure Execution ontology (https://w3id.org/pep/).

Name: SEAS Periodic Signal Property Ontology
Short description: This ontology defines properties that evolve periodically in time, and evaluations of these properties.

Name: SEAS Pricing ontology
Short description: The SEAS Pricing ontology defines the different categories of princing we can meet in the market vacabulary.

Name: SEAS Statistics Ontology
Short description: This ontology defines common evaluation interpretation concepts for statistics.

Name: SEAS Trading Ontology
Short description: The SEAS Trading Ontology defines concepts and relations to describe ownership, trading, bilateral contracts and market licenses.

Name: SEAS Time Ontology
Short description: This ontology defines: (1) a set of subclasses of `seas:Evaluation` to better interpret evaluations of quantifiable properties. (2) a set of sub properties of `seas:hasProperty` to qualify time-related properties.

Name: SEAS Zone Lighting ontology
Short description: The SEAS Zone Lighting ontology describes light sources and illuminable zones.

Name: Schemaorg
Short description: Schema.org is a collaborative,community activity with a mission to create,maintain,and promote schemas for structured data on the Internet,on web pages,in email messages and beyond.

Name: Semanticscience Integrated Ontology (SIO)
Short description: The semanticscience integrated ontology (SIO) provides a simple, integrated ontology (types, relations) for objects, processes and their attributes.

Name: Semiotics
Short description: The semiotics module is based on the semiotic theory by Charles S.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: SemWeb Vocab Status ontology
Short description: An RDF vocabulary for relating Semantic Web vocabulary terms to their status.

Name: Simple Feature Ontology
Short description: An OWL ontology of the Simple Features geometry types.

Name: Simple Knowledge Organization System
Short description: An RDF vocabulary for describing the basic structure and content of concept schemes such as thesauri, classification schemes, subject heading lists, taxonomies,'folksonomies',other types of controlled vocabulary and also concept schemes embedded in glossaries and terminologies.
Authors/creators: Dave Beckett,Nikki Rogers,Alistair Miles,Sean Bechhofer,Participants in W3C's Semantic Web Deployment Working Group

Name: SimplePartWhole
Short description: An ontology containing the basic part relations: partOf, hasPart, partOf_directly, and hasPart_directly.

Name: SIOC Core Ontology Namespace
Short description: SIOC (Semantically-Interlinked Online Communities) is an ontology for describing the information in online communities.
Authors/creators: Diego Berrueta,Dan Brickley,Stefan Decker,Sergio Fernández,Christoph Görn,Andreas Harth,Tom Heath,Kingsley Idehen,Kjetil Kjernsmo,Alistair Miles,Alexandre Passant,Axel Polleres,Luis Polo

Name: SIOC Services Ontology Module Namespace
Short description: Extends the SIOC Core Ontology (Semantically-Interlinked Online Communities) by defining basic information on community-related web services.

Name: Situation Ontology-Design-Pattern
Short description: Information not available

Name: SI units
Short description: The module 'siunits' defines the 7 base units and 22 derived units as well as the metric prefixes specified in the SI system.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: skos4ExtruOnt
Short description: submodule from: SKOS Simple Knowledge Organization System RDF Schema.

Name: SmartProducts Food Domain Model
Short description: Defines concepts and properties specific for the Philips use case (cooking domain).

Name: SmartProducts Process model
Short description: Defines concepts descripting workflows and activities.

Name: SmartProducts User model
Short description: Contains concepts related to the user and user profile.

Name: spatial4ExtruOnt
Short description: An RDF/OWL schema for representing the Region Connection Calculus (RCC8).
Authors/creators: BDI – Interoperable Databases GroupUniversity of the Basque Country UPV/EHU

Name: SPIN Modeling Vocabulary
Short description: An RDF Schema that can be used to attach constraints and rules to RDFS classes, and to encapsulate reusable SPARQL queries into functions and templates.

Name: SPIN Standard Library
Short description: A collection of generally useful SPARQL functions (expressed as SPIN functions),and SPIN templates. Also provides a top-level classification of functions, and definitions of the standard SPARQL functions.

Name: SPIN SPARQL Syntax
Short description: An RDF schema to syntactically represent SPARQL queries and update commands as RDF triples.

Name: SPIN SPIF
Short description: A library of generally useful SPARQL functions defined using SPIN.

Name: sqwrl
Short description: Information not available

Name: SUMO CORA
Short description: This is the OWL implementation of SUMO as used by IEEE 1872-2015.

Name: SWRLAPI
Short description: Helper classes and properties to work with SWRLAPI.

Name: TaxonConcept Ontology
Short description: This is an ontology for dealing with data related to species including observations, specimens, images etc. Traditionally species have been identified by the combination of a genus and specific epithet, for example Puma concolor.

Name: TaxonMap Ontology
Short description: This is the initial vocabulary for Mapping the various taxon classes on the Linked Open Data Cloud.

Name: Units extension
Short description: The module 'units-extension' defines all units in EMMO middle that are not included in the 'siumits' module.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: VANN
Short description: This document describes a vocabulary for annotating descriptions of vocabularies with examples and usage notes.

Name: Vocabulary for Attaching Essential Metadata
Short description: Information not available

Name: Vocabulary for BLCS stages
Short description: Vocabulary of lifecycle stages based on the frameworks of ISO 22263, RIBA, and HOAI.

Name: Vocabulary for LOD levels
Short description: Vocabulary of LOD levels based on established frameworks in EU, IT, UK and USA.

Name: Vocabulary for multi-dimensional (eg statistical) data publishing
Short description: This vocabulary allows multi-dimensional data, such as statistics, to be published in RDF.

Name: Vocabulary for publishing SDMX statistical data in RDF
Short description: This vocabulary extends the data cube vocabulary to support publication of statistical data in RDF, using an information model based on SDMX.

Name: Vocabulary of a Friend
Short description: VOAF is a vocabulary specification providing elements allowing the description of vocabularies (RDFS vocabularies or OWL ontologies) used in the Linked Data Cloud, in particular it provides properties expressing the different ways such vocabularies can rely on, extend, specify, annotate or otherwise link to each other.

Name: Vocabulary of Interlinked Datasets
Short description: It is an RDF Schema vocabulary for expressing metadata about RDF datasets.

Name: W3C PROV-O Inverses
Short description: Information not available

Name: W3C PROV Linking Across Provenance Bundles Ontology
Short description: Provides linking across provenance bundles.

Name: W3C Timezone
Short description: A time zone ontology.

Name: WADL Ontology-Design-Pattern
Short description: An ontology of WADL which is a standard to describe properties.

Name: Weather Knowledge Graph (Ontology and Dataset)
Short description: Description of the weather domain as an ontology with a set of rules.

Name: Web Of Trust vocabulary
Short description: Web Of Trust (wot) RDF vocabulary, described using W3C RDF Schema and the Web Ontology Language.

Name: Web Ontology Language
Short description: The OWL 2 Web Ontology Language, informally OWL 2, is an ontology language for the Semantic Web with formally defined meaning.
